summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 discussing how to handle six Touhy requests related to the Jeffrey Epstein case that were submitted under pseudonyms. The correspondence involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel debating the proper procedure, requiring the requester to submit formal requests with specific names and details in writing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the Touhy requests are related to him.

events.title: Submission of pseudonymous Touhy requests
events.description: Six Touhy requests related to Jeffrey Epstein were submitted under pseudonyms, prompting internal discussion on how to process them.

keyFacts: Six Epstein-related Touhy requests were submitted under pseudonyms in October 2020.
The criminal team stated they did not know the identities of the victims making the requests.
The U.S. Attorney's Office decided to require the requester to re-submit with real names in writing, rejecting verbal disclosure.
Internal discussion highlighted concerns about the impact of disclosure on the criminal case and witnesses.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal and procedural activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
